source.text_arabic: قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ * اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ * لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ * وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ
source.text_english: Say, He is Allah, [who is] One, Allah, the Eternal Refuge. He neither begets nor is born, nor is there to Him any equivalent.

target.text_arabic_snippet: قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ تَعْدِلُ ثُلُثَ الْقُرْآنِ
target.text_english_snippet: Say: He is Allah, the One - equals one-third of the Quran

sources.author: Ibn Kathir
sources.relevance: Explains the pure monotheism in Surah Al-Ikhlas

sources.author: Ibn Hajar al-Asqalani
sources.relevance: Commentary on the virtue of Al-Ikhlas equaling one-third of the Quran

scholarly_consensus.notes: Unanimous agreement that Al-Ikhlas is the purest expression of Tawhid

historical_context.historical_notes: Revealed in Mecca as response to polytheists asking about Allah's nature

source.text_arabic: فَاعْلَمْ أَنَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَاسْتَغْفِرْ لِذَنبِكَ
source.text_english: So know that there is no deity except Allah and ask forgiveness for your sin

target.text_arabic_snippet: أَيُّ الْعَمَلِ أَفْضَلُ؟ قَالَ: إِيمَانٌ بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ
target.text_english_snippet: Which deed is the best? He said: To believe in Allah and His Messenger

sources.author: Al-Qurtubi
sources.relevance: Explains the command to have knowledge of Tawhid

sources.author: Ibn Hajar
sources.relevance: Best deed is faith in Allah

source.text_arabic: أَقِمِ الصَّلَاةَ لِدُلُوكِ الشَّمْسِ إِلَىٰ غَسَقِ اللَّيْلِ وَقُرْآنَ الْفَجْرِ ۖ إِنَّ قُرْآنَ الْفَجْرِ كَانَ مَشْهُودًا
source.text_english: Establish prayer at the decline of the sun until the darkness of the night and [also] the Quran of dawn. Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.

target.text_arabic_snippet: خَمْسُ صَلَوَاتٍ افْتَرَضَهُنَّ اللَّهُ تَعَالَى: صَلاَةُ الظُّهْرِ، وَالْعَصْرِ، وَالْمَغْرِبِ، وَالْعِشَاءِ، وَالْفَجْرِ
target.text_english_snippet: Five prayers which Allah has made obligatory: Zuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha, and Fajr

sources.author: Ibn Kathir
sources.relevance: Explanation of the five daily prayer times from this verse

sources.author: Al-Ayni
sources.relevance: Scholarly consensus on five prayers

scholarly_consensus.notes: All scholars agree this verse establishes the five prayer times

source.text_arabic: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلْمُصَلِّينَ * الَّذِينَ هُمْ عَن صَلَاتِهِمْ سَاهُونَ
source.text_english: So woe to those who pray, who are heedless of their prayer

target.text_arabic_snippet: الَّذِي تَفُوتُهُ صَلاَةُ الْعَصْرِ فَكَأَنَّمَا وُتِرَ أَهْلَهُ وَمَالَهُ
target.text_english_snippet: He who misses the Asr prayer, it is as if he has been robbed of his family and property

sources.relevance: Warns against delaying or being heedless in prayer
Severe warning for missing Asr

source.text_arabic: إِنَّمَا الصَّدَقَاتُ لِلْفُقَرَاءِ وَالْمَسَاكِينِ وَالْعَامِلِينَ عَلَيْهَا
source.text_english: Zakah expenditures are only for the poor and for the needy and for those employed to collect [zakah]

target.text_arabic_snippet: إِنَّ اللَّهَ افْتَرَضَ عَلَيْهِمْ صَدَقَةً فِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ تُؤْخَذُ مِنْ أَغْنِيَائِهِمْ وَتُرَدُّ عَلَى فُقَرَائِهِمْ
target.text_english_snippet: Allah has made obligatory upon them a charity from their wealth, taken from their rich and given to their poor

sources.author: Al-Tabari
sources.relevance: Detailed explanation of the eight categories of zakat recipients
Legal rulings on zakat distribution

scholarly_consensus.notes: Consensus on the eight categories of zakat recipients

source.text_arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا أَنفِقُوا مِن طَيِّبَاتِ مَا كَسَبْتُمْ وَمِمَّا أَخْرَجْنَا لَكُم مِّنَ الْأَرْضِ
source.text_english: O you who have believed, spend from the good things which you have earned and from that which We have produced for you from the earth

target.text_arabic_snippet: مَا نَقَصَتْ صَدَقَةٌ مِنْ مَالٍ، وَمَا زَادَ اللَّهُ عَبْدًا بِعَفْوٍ إِلاَّ عِزًّا
target.text_english_snippet: Charity does not decrease wealth, and Allah increases in honor the one who forgives

sources.relevance: Command to spend from pure earnings
Virtue and blessings of charity

source.text_arabic: إِنَّا أَنزَلْنَاهُ فِي لَيْلَةِ الْقَدْرِ * وَمَا أَدْرَاكَ مَا لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ * لَيْلَةُ الْقَدْرِ خَيْرٌ مِّنْ أَلْفِ شَهْرٍ
source.text_english: Indeed, We sent the Quran down during the Night of Decree. And what can make you know what is the Night of Decree? The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months

target.text_arabic_snippet: مَنْ قَامَ لَيْلَةَ الْقَدْرِ إِيمَانًا وَاحْتِسَابًا غُفِرَ لَهُ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِهِ
target.text_english_snippet: Whoever stands (in prayer) on Laylatul-Qadr with faith and seeking reward, his previous sins will be forgiven

sources.author: Al-Qurtubi
sources.relevance: Explanation of Laylatul-Qadr in Ramadan
Virtue of standing in prayer on Laylatul-Qadr

scholarly_consensus.notes: Consensus that Laylatul-Qadr is in Ramadan, especially last ten nights

source.text_arabic: أُحِلَّ لَكُمْ لَيْلَةَ الصِّيَامِ الرَّفَثُ إِلَىٰ نِسَائِكُمْ... وَكُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا حَتَّىٰ يَتَبَيَّنَ لَكُمُ الْخَيْطُ الْأَبْيَضُ مِنَ الْخَيْطِ الْأَسْوَدِ مِنَ الْفَجْرِ ۖ ثُمَّ أَتِمُّوا الصِّيَامَ إِلَى اللَّيْلِ
source.text_english: It has been made permissible for you the night preceding fasting to go to your wives... And eat and drink until the white thread of dawn becomes distinct from the black thread [of night]. Then complete the fast until the sunset

target.text_arabic_snippet: إِذَا أَقْبَلَ اللَّيْلُ مِنْ هَا هُنَا، وَأَدْبَرَ النَّهَارُ مِنْ هَا هُنَا، وَغَرَبَتِ الشَّمْسُ فَقَدْ أَفْطَرَ الصَّائِمُ
target.text_english_snippet: When the night approaches from this side and the day departs from this side and the sun sets, then the fasting person should break his fast

sources.relevance: Explanation of fasting times from dawn to sunset
Rules for breaking fast at sunset

source.text_arabic: وَأَذِّن فِي النَّاسِ بِالْحَجِّ يَأْتُوكَ رِجَالًا وَعَلَىٰ كُلِّ ضَامِرٍ يَأْتِينَ مِن كُلِّ فَجٍّ عَمِيقٍ
source.text_english: And proclaim to the people the Hajj [pilgrimage]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every distant pass

target.text_arabic_snippet: الْحَجُّ عَرَفَةُ، مَنْ جَاءَ قَبْلَ صَلاَةِ الْفَجْرِ مِنْ لَيْلَةِ جَمْعٍ فَقَدْ تَمَّ حَجُّهُ
target.text_english_snippet: Hajj is Arafah. Whoever comes before the Fajr prayer on the night of Muzdalifah, his Hajj is complete

sources.relevance: Explanation of the call to Hajj and its rituals
The centrality of Arafah in Hajj

scholarly_consensus.notes: All scholars agree Arafah is the central pillar of Hajj

source.text_english: And complete the Hajj and Umrah for Allah

target.text_arabic_snippet: مَنْ حَجَّ لِلَّهِ فَلَمْ يَرْفُثْ وَلَمْ يَفْسُقْ رَجَعَ كَيَوْمِ وَلَدَتْهُ أُمُّهُ
target.text_english_snippet: Whoever performs Hajj for Allah and does not commit obscenity or wickedness, he returns [free from sin] as on the day his mother gave birth to him

sources.relevance: Command to complete Hajj and Umrah for Allah
Spiritual purification through Hajj
